clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Calcium and Vitamin D on Bone Loss From the Hip
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Calcium and Vitamin D on Bone Loss From the Hip

brief_summary.textblock: The primary aim of this study is to determine the effects of supplementation with both calcium and vitamin D on changes in bone density of the hip in men and women age 65 and older.

detailed_description.textblock: In this study 445 men and women age 65 and older were enrolled for three years each. Subjects were randomized to treatment with 500 mg of calcium s calcium citrate malate plus 700 IU of vitamin D daily or placebo. Subjects came to the research center every six months for biochemical and bone mineral density measurements. Changes in these measures over the three years were determined in each group and compared.

secondary_outcome.measure: Annual and Seasonal patterns of change in bone mineral density of the hip
Associations between biochemical, physical and life-style factors
Examine influence of clinical status, lifestyle, medication use and season on the occurrence of falls

intervention.intervention_name: Calcium 500 mg/day and vitamin D 700 IU/day

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
>65 years calcium intake < 1500 mg/day Willing to discontinue calcium and vitamin D pills for 2 months prior to enrollment
Exclusion Criteria:
Mentally incompetent, femoral neck BMD greater than 2 SD above/below age/sex-matched reference mean, 24-hr urine calcium/creatinine > 300 mg/d women or >350 mg/d men terminal illness, renal disease requiring treatment, kidney stone in the past 10 years, current hyperparathyroidism, treated with glucocorticoids, estrogen or androgen, fluoride, calcitonin, bisphosphonate, or any other treatment for osteoporosis.

facility.name: Human Nutrition Research Center on Aging at Tufts U

results_reference.citation: Dawson-Hughes B, Harris SS, Krall EA, Dallal GE. Effect of calcium and vitamin D supplementation on bone density in men and women 65 years of age or older. N Engl J Med. 1997 Sep 4;337(10):670-6.
